citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The temperature inside the refrigerator where the dog vaccines are stored is 54 degrees F according to the inspector's
Kestrel. The label on the vaccines states they should be stored at 35-46 degrees F. Failure to store vaccines at the proper
temperatures may affect their ability to protect the animals from serious and deadly diseases.
Each dealer must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The licensee
must ensure that all vaccines are stored at the proper temperatures at all times.
Correction date: End of business November 18, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The temperature inside the refrigerator where the dog vaccines are stored is 54 degrees F according to the inspector's 
Kestrel. The label on the vaccines states they should be stored at 35-46 degrees F. Failure to store vaccines at the proper 
temperatures may affect their ability to protect the animals from serious and deadly diseases. 
 
Each dealer must use appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The licensee 
must ensure that all vaccines are stored at the proper temperatures at all times. 
 
Correction date: End of business November 18, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End Section
